lines.text: The story is from a novel entitled Lavender and Old Lace, but the name of the cinema has been changed to... um... She Done Him Plenty.
Have you a favorite movie star, Princess?
Oh, yah yah.
Would it be a male star?
Oh sure.
If the question isn't too personal, the name?
Vee tell you. Mickey Moose-y.
What is that?
Why it's one of those things, you know, one of those come-to-you go-from-you things.
A concertina. And very vulgar. A definite symbol of the lower classes. Put the thing on the floor and it crawls.
My dear, I am an old woman. I have travelled at home and abroad, and *never, never* have I known any good to come out of a concertina.
Scram.
What did you say?
Oh... Scrom. In Sweeden, it means the interview is ended.
Poor, dear Uncle Rudy. Somebody was always shooting at him.
In my country, they shoot at everybody's uncle.
Your Highness, there's something wrong with your tub.
Vat?

Yes, you see, the water runs in and it runs out, but the trouble is it runs out faster than it runs in. I discovered it this morning when I was trying to take a bath. It can only draw about that much water
[his fingers show an inch]
and you can't take a bath with that much water
[shows an inch again]
Vell, if you're a ploomb-er, why don't you fix it?
Well, I'm not a ploomb-er, uh, I mean, a plumber, but I think I could fix it. Have you got a screwdriver?
A screwdriver? Her Highness is not in the habit of going around with a screwdriver on her person.

[to Mantell]
Please go avay.
Well, I was only trying to help, but may I suggest that when you want to take a bath, you should take a shower.
[walks away]
Of course, there's always the ocean.
[Exits]

[dropping her phony Swedish accent]
I'd like to smack that guy right in the kisser.
Oh, my poof!
[fishing out her sopping wet powder puff]
Your what?
My powder poof! It is vet!
[squeezing it out onto his shoes]
You enjoyed the cocktails, didn't you?
The first two or three. After the fifth or sixth I was utterly bored.
Well boss, do I toss him to the sharks?
What's the matter? Don't you like sharks?
Where did you spend the evening, Mr. Mantell?
Right here.
Did you entertain a visitor?
No, nobody was here.
You were alone?
Well, practically. I was with Benton.
Yeah, we were *both* alone.
